Pours slightly hazy amber with white/orange head. Aroma is orange hops with mild spices. Flavor is smooth with sweet honeysuckle and caramel malt with mild orange hip bitter character.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

12oz bottle DOB 08/03/16 at 5:27AM - prolly the most specific DOB Ive ever seen. Whos up at 5:27 to brew beer? Thats the story I want to know. Now to try this currently to 50 for the style beer. Nose is grassy, caramel and buttery "biscuits" from Normandy. Sip adds light booze, citrus and more grass. I should say I should mowed my overgrown yard and Im getting similar flavors. Dry finish. Interesting flavor and modest taste.

Draft. Not reminiscent of an English style bitter. This is more similar to an American pale ale with its hop-forward aroma and flavors. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
light malt aroma. gold and lightly hazy in color with no head. taste is towards the hoppy side. flavors are of piney, resinous hops with caramel malt undertones

Bottle pour into nonic pint glass from Julios Liquors. Appearance is clear gold/light amber with faint sparkle, 1/2-finger width fizzy white head with poor retention and trace lacing. Aroma is light malt, fruit, resin. Taste is fruit, resin, with mild earth and malt base. Palate is medium bodied with thick texture, average carbonation and malty and light citrus finish. Overall, good amount of hops though a lot of that is bitter resin, which isnt my favorite. Good for the style.

Pours clear orange, a bit of tan head. Aroma of grapefruit, hay, toast,bread. Taste is balance of piney, grassy, spicy hops, and bready grainy malt. A beer that tastes like beer, in a good way. Medium mouthfeel.
Pours and orange color with a foamy off white head. Mouthfeel is lively but slightly sweet. Notes of carmel, toffee, dry grains, earthy hops. Good and well balanced.
Faint toasty malt aroma with a sweet reason hop body finish is with brown sugar. Very nice.

On tap at Sedona. Taste is perfumery soap, floral, light vegetation, citrus. Yum 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
a little strong and hoppy for an esb. Nice floral aroma with underlying toasy=ted malt. Flavor much the same, grainy and moderately bitter.
Bottle. Pours hazy dark golden off-white head. Floral and toasted malt aroma. Medium sweet taste. Medium body, mild bitter finish. Very well balanced.

12 ounce bottle. Amber orange color. Small fluffy beige head. Toasted grain and fruity hops in nose. Flavor follows nose with caramel notes and tropical fruit. Complex hops in middle add spice and depth. Finish is bitter and peppery. Delicious.

Bottle - average size foamy head, dark copper color, good balanced aroma and flavor, toasty biscuity malt with earthy and fruity hops, very good overall 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma: caramel, citrus, bread, 
Appearance: deep golden with an off-white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: medium body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter finish, 

Tasty

Light/medium aroma with sweet malts, some honey and a hint of fruits. Deeper golden/orange color with minimal white head and hazy liquid. Medium organic slightly bitter fruity aroma with bit sweet malts, some hops. Averagely balanced with medium taste spectrum and medium hoppy malty aftertaste. Medium/light body with medium/light carbonation. Overall, decent nicely fruity in its class.
pours a deep amber color with a thin off white head. The aromas are floral, earthy, leather. The mouthfeel is dry and slightly bitter with a medium body and medium carbonation.

Slightly cloudy copper in appearance with dissipating white head. Soft slightly sour aroma. Nice balance of floral hops and carmel malt. Smooth mouthfeel with little carbonation. Some floral bitterness in the finish. Nice balance of malt and hop.

Botte. Pours a clear orange color with a thin tan head. Strong, malty aroma with a light hop presence. Caramel malt in the flavor. Light, dry hoppy notes. Pretty solid brew. Southern Tier never disappoints.
Big sour mash hop aromas on the nose. Clear amber color with very lasting head. Definitely English flavor that has a light hop that get enveloped by the malts.
Average appearance, medium brown. Clean aroma, of spices, citrus, malt. Taste is exactly how it smells.. a clean, simple, spicy,zesty citrus malt.

12 Fl. Oz. Bottle. Poured clear, golden with a small white head and spotty lacing. Aroma is hoppy, some spices and some barley. Taste is hoppy but well balanced with. Malts and grain. Very solid, easy to drink and certainly quite enjoyable.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Clear dark amber color, persistent 1/2" white head, streaks of lace. Standard aroma of malt and hops, but pleasing. Taste is solid malt with some toffee that grows smoothly through the swallow to a finish that has noticeable hops, but not the kind to block out everything else. Id put this brew right beside Fullers. Well done! (and a surprise, since I was expecting spices and pumpkin).

Appearance: Amber Golden Orange. Aroma: Fruity Esters, Orange, Citrusy Hops. Taste: Orange, Carmel, Citrus, Malt, Bready, Hay.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Pours an amber color with a decent head. Crisp flavor with significant bittering hops but without a bad aftertaste. Drinkable but not great.
Smell is malty. Taste very swell and malty. Great beer love you guys and your beers. Keep them coming.

Poured into pint a nice Amber with white head. Aroma is sweet malts, Carmel, bread. Floral hops in background. In the sip I get floral hops that slowly turn Carmel and bready malts. Finish has hop bitterness. Good balance between hop and malt. Nice

Bottle. Dark Amber. Bready malt with floral hops and caramel. Very English. Solid, not bad

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had it on tap. It pours a somewhat cloudy copper color with an off-white head. The aroma is floral hops and bread. The taste is strong on hops. Its definitely bitter. Its crisp with carbonation and an abrupt finish. As it warmed, the alcohol became very pronounced. This was pretty good.
Draught @ Rattle&Hum. Clear dark orange with small foamy off-white head, faint caramel aroma, medium carbonation, bitter caramelized malt taste, abrupt finish with little bitter aftertaste. Nice ESB.
Sampled at tasting...not into esb brews but had to try...actually pretty good had some hops was mellow on the malt..pretty good brew.

Bottle from Market Street Frisco. Pours a deep amber color with a thin off white head. The aromas are floral, earthy, leather. The mouthfeel is dry and slightly bitter with a medium body and medium carbonation. Cheers!  *** Not a re-rate.  Just fixed my mis-typed words.

DATE TASTED: September 19, 2015 ... GLASSWARE: Brew at the Zoo pint... OCCASION: mid-afternoon relaxation following another ugly soccer loss... APPEARANCE: mostly clear, orange amber body (I have the right bottle, but no WAY is this ruby, as the above summary states!) that offers reasonable effervescence... head is off-white, thick, and palpable... lacing forms appropriately,, almost like coral...a good-looking pint... AROMA: no doubt East Kent Golding, with that floral, lavender and lemon... spicy enough to also have Tettnanger or Spaltz... the fruitiness is strong for an ESB.. some clove and thyme work their way in, for a full, pleasing array... PALATE: medium to full-bodied, with a sizzle at the start and a strong, lasting malty finish... active and engaging, some froth too, and unlike many ESBs with lesser character... TASTE: a good, roasted quality sits in the throat, with mild caramel developing an ever-present sweetness that pervades the whole of the experience; the hop profile is decidedly balanced too, though undercut by the malts, with citrus, flower, fruit and earthiness smoothed together in a drinkable blend that begs for pub fare or a game to watch...OVERALL: What must be the "Harvest" quality is the label itself--this is a wonderful approximation of the British standard with enough character to set itself slightly apart from the predictable; at 6.7% ABV deceptively sessionable... sweet and smooth--another success from Southern Tier...

Hands down the best ESB Ive ever had the pleasure of drinking. The malts and hops are in chorus with each other, beckoning you for sip after sip. I honestly wish I had an entire case of this. Excellent for the style.

Pours amber/brown, average head, average carbonation. The aroma is mild apples and spice, and a little bit of hoppy tingle. The flavor isnt strong upfront, but the back of the tongue is a smooth flood of warm malt. Orange pekoe tea and caramel round it out. Pretty good.

Amber with login rimming beige head; hoppy sweet and spicy aroma; flava dry woody malt with hint of sweetness and then hops come through ; feels medium to light little fizz ; finishes hoppy slight bitter twang

Bottle shared at Leightons place. 25/08/2015. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. Translucent golden orange coloured pour with a thin white head. Aroma is sweet toffee, nutty malts, earthy twang, and some berry hop. Flavour is composed of nutty, light twig, tangy berry, light papaer, Palate is semi-sweet, moderate carbonation, little chewy. Lingering jammy fruits.
Golden/amber color ; thin , white head. Bread , caramel , floral and citrus notes in aroma. Moderate grainy sweetness and decent hoppy bitterness in taste . Slightly astringent finish .

Pours a clear darker coppery amber color with off-white head. Caramel malt, light fruits notes, and some toffee on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied. Finishes with toffee and fruit notes.

Bottle share at Leightons. Hazy murky brown, lightly sparkling, small foamy off-white head. Aroma is custard creams, chlorine swimming pool, caramel. Body is medium, smooth, tingly carbonation. Taste is toffee, biscuity, earthy with a dry finish. Pretty decent.

Bottle shared in London - thanks to Daniel. Pours clear gold with a frothy off-white head. The nose has some rindy citrus, leafy hops, toasted grains. Light to medium sweet flavor with some herbal hops, orange rind, sugary bread, some graham crackers. Medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Finishes with toasted grainy malts, light caramel, honey, aged pine. Not bad.

Bottle thanks to Dan. It pours cloudy orange - amber with a small white head. The nose is fresh, toasty, grainy, brown bread, apricot, marmalade, cereal and fruit cake. The taste is bitter, toasty, grain, brown bread, light spice, brown bread, cereal and light stone fruits with a dry finish. Medium body and average carbonation. Rather quaffable stuff.

UPDATED: AUG 31, 2015 Draft at The Irish Pol. Hazy deep amber pour with a fair amount of soft off-white foam. Lace. Toasty bitter with lots of earthy floral hops. Forest floor. Blonde toffee caramels. Spicy oranges spiked with cinnamon. Bitter buttered Challah bread. Chanterelle mushrooms. Dandelions. Wildflower honey. Green peppercorns. Medium-full body. Better than anticipated.

Aroma caramel, cereal, citrus, 
Appearance amber, clear, frothy, white foam, 
Taste light sweetness, lightly bitter, salty, 
Palate medium body, bitter, 
Overall a great beer to enjoy on a beautiful fall night. I would suggest this beer to a friend.
Caramel, bread crust, biscuit, mild nutty, red apple, herbaceous/spicy/mild citric hops. A bit sticky on the palate for the style

Ambar oscura, miel. Escasa espuma blanca. Turbia. Aroma muy potente, que se nota desde muy lejos. Pino, floral. Excelente en boca. Muy frutal, floral y lupulada, melocotón, flores. También se deja notar la malta, dando un toque acaramelado, muy rico. Un excelente ejemplo de ale americana con magnífico tono lupulado pero sin el amargor de una IPA.
Bottle. Very hoppy nose. Medium amber color. Medium carbonation. Very robust hoppy taste, just bordering on astringent. Overall, a strong tasty ale, one of my new favorites
12 oz bottle. Amber orange with a decent off-white head. Aroma is of oranges, spicy hops, grain, dandelions, and dried apricots. Taste is of spicy hops, moss, earth, bitter florals.
Bottle. The look is clear, white head, orange pumpkin colored. The smell is grainy, slight spiced, rye, florals, and perfumes. The taste is a pleasent, grainy, sweet, florals, good.
This brew is excellent! The extra hops lends a powerful kick in the aroma. The taste is toasty barley wonderland--I just love it. I would certainly get this again when it comes out again next fall.

Pour out of 12 oz bottle, hazy orange pour with white head, aroma brought notes of caramel, toffee, spice, yeast, some bready and toast, hints of earth, nice buttered popcorn. Taste is a mix of grass, butter, bread, hints of spice, yeast, some red fruit, finishing bitter, grassy, buttered toast. Very nice, wish there was a bit more malty notes, finishing bitter, slightly sweet.

Une bouteille partagée. Un liquide jaune dorée avec une mousse blanche. Un nez agréable de houblon et de grain sec. Une touche de caramel agrémante le tout. Une bouche bien faite avec des notes de grains et de houblon. Une finale amère.

Bonne bière offerte par rodenbach99. Houblons américains et touche anglaise. Malts grillés. Aucun sucre résiduel. Bonne sécheresse. Trois ou quatre gorgées plus loin, le verre est déjà fini. Facile à boire avec sa pointe citronnée en arrière-goût. Une véritable aubaine. Jaimerais bien la reboire un jour.

Pours a clear copper orange color about a one finger beige head. Nose is grass, grapefruit, mango. Medium body, medium carbonation, medium caramel sweetness, dry finish, slight bitterness. Great interpretation of the style, even if its more IPA like.

Appearance: deep gold, with some pinkish orange amber highlights, with one finger of foamy just off-white head thats extremely persistent.  Aroma: grapefruit, apricot, blood orange, some toasty rye bread. Taste: grapefruit and spruce are in your face right up front, with the bitterness holding over as some sweet fruits and light grains try to come through.  Finish:  astringent, but slick and smooth, with a lasting bright bitterness, a bit of toast, a surprising shot of mint, and just a hint of hand soap. Notes: Would have liked just a bit more malt backbone to balance this, with maybe a tad more heft in the palate. Maybe some rye. Maybe I was just really jonesing for their 2X Rye when I had this Bottle from Total Wine, McLean, Virginia.
Draft. Nice bitter ale style beer, with nice hops presence on the first taste. Nice Amber color and white head. Very smooth finish with more hops on the back end.

It pours golden with an orange tinge. The white head sticks around for a while. It does produce some lacing. There is an aroma of hay, barley, and grassy hops. It has a sweet taste to it with grassy hops. It has a bitter finish as well.
Rated from notes taken 14 Sep 2011 -- An Americanized ESB, heavy on the hops, light on the malt. Nice.
On draft at Isaac Newtons. The tip of my tongue was swimming in bitter notes of citrus, dough, floral hop and some grapefruit. Zesty finish. Not bad.
Poured from a bottle it is a clear do laden color with a white head it has the aroma of a yoga mat the taste is malty and lingers bitter on the palate
From a 12 oz bottle shared at home. Pours a clear copper with a thick white head. Fruity nose. Flavors of citrus with a malty backbone. Close to an IPA and quite tasty.

Not a real big fan of this one. I guess I dont really gravitate towards ESBs but this one just doesnt do much for me. It does alright in the "fall themed" category but overall just isnt my kinda brew.
Bottle - Pours a deep, clear golden with creamy,quickly dissipating head. Aroma of sweet bread and some citrus. Nice balance with a little bitterness. Well made ESB.

Tasted from bottle. Pours a hazy orange with nice fluffy off white head. Good lacing. Aroma is bready, biscuits, caramel and earthy notes. Taste is an exceptionally well balanced bitter. Moderate sweetness with caramel and biscuity malt flavors with moderate bitterness of mostly earthy notes. Probably the best ESB I've had. Very well done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

When I want a hoppy beer I want this one. A fine example of a good bitter. Has a bite but finishes clean. I prefer this beer with a good hamburger or steak.

Overall a good beer when you something with a kick of bitterness.
This grew on me as I finished the glass. Well balanced with citrus up front and cardamon lingering after. Light and easy, a good beer for day outside.
Light bronze body with some head, not much retention, slight lacing. Lovely mix of hops and malts. A little bitter. If this is an ESB, count me in on ESBs.
Very drinkable beer for any season, but for the fall season is a very good option.

Poured a hazy amber colour with a white head that leaves nice lacing. Very bready and hoppy/earthy aroma. Very apparent malt flavors with spicy and earthy hops. A bitter hoppy finish in this lightly carbonated medium brew. Conjures up images of an IPA/Oktoberfest Blend.

Pours a pretty clear amber with a finger of head. Nose floral hops, sweet bready note, bit of citrus. Taste is rye, bready, a lot of hop profile, a bit herbal, a grapefruit pith at the end. It's ok. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Julie hates this I like its unique blend I gots to work soon and party at the church

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A very damn good ESB. Light but fresh citrus hops with a fall aroma of rotting leaves. Orange pour, good head and lacing. Very drinkable, great session beer for season. Light bitter finish. Tap at Pizzeria Paradiso.

This bottled brew from a bottle shop poured a head of foamy with a frothy top fine to large sized off-white colored bubbles that were long lasting and left behind a typically carbonated transparent golden orange brown colored body and a good lacing. The mild aroma was musty. sharp semi-thick crisp with a bitter hoppy aftertaste. The semi-sharp flavor contained notes of bitter mild brown malt and hops. Delicious and one I would certainly buy again.
Had outside by the fire. Very flavorful fall beer...Crisp taste. ...................

Copper color with a nice retentive white head. Malty and lightly hoppy aroma. Crisp and moderately malty with a nice delicate sweetness and very green earthy bitterness. Finish is earthy hippy. Delicious.
Pours hazy light amber with short white head. Aroma is malt dominant with a hint of fruity hop. Taste is very malty and delicious. A favorite harvest ale.

Pours a medium amber with a one finger white head with nice lacing. Aroma is of citrus, caramel, pine, grassy hops, sweet malts, and toffee. Taste is similar to the aroma with the addition of some ligh tropical fruits. Has a medium body with a creamy mouthfeel and a slighty dry, semi-moderately bitter, medium-long finish. Overall, a very nice ESB that has good fall vibe to it.
They aint lying about the bitter and it is pretty special. Maybe even extra special. Caramel malt, pine and grass hops and bitter bitterness.
Bottle. Very hoppy nose. Medium amber color. Medium carbonation. Very robust hoppy taste, just bordering on astringent. Overall, a strong tasty ale, one of my new favorites.
Big draft at Harolds Restaurant in Hopewell, PA. Slight tastes of spice and a pleasant warmth and smoothness. Perfect for a cooler evening.

Clear medium amber pour coupled with a dash of dark ruby and with a good head. Retention is normal, lacing is above normal. Very nice nose of blended hops (citric, tropical and a touch of dank pine) over a light biscuit. Light medium body with a smooth texture. Slightly above normal carbonation with a nice effervescent finish. Very nice balanced flavor profile that is complex. It begins with a rush of hop flavor - the citric and tropicals lead then flow into a dank note that is much more prevalent than suggested in the nose. The middle is a mild bitterness over biscuit, with a touch of caramel, light sweetness. The finish somewhat dry, but leaves you with the classic English ESB flavors and bitterness over a fading light biscuit. The 6.7% alcohol is completely hidden in this outstanding ESB.

I have a love hate relationship w/ ST beers. Ordered this cause it was only thing on draft I havent had. For style, best American esb Ive had in a while. So nice to be surprised by something. Little more hop bite to it then other esbs. Really dig the malt profile on this. Well done brew.
Really liked it. A nice fall beer that is malty and delicous. Pours a hazy orange color.

was expecting something different from the name, happy with what i got .. . pours a deep caramel orange .. . such a solid bitterness .. . dark brown hay, crust, and assorted grain .. . a great beer, in the top from american breweries for this style .. . . i dont remember the last time i went to a diner and had a big slice of pie. or ever.
12oz bottle. nice hops taste, pine and grassy, just a touch of spice and sweetness

On tap in the Tasting Room at the brewery at 6.7% ABV. Amber with a thin white head; aroma of malts and grassy hops; great grapefruit taste - crisp, clean and fruity; with a residual caramel sweetness. Satisfying.
Had on draft. Very nice. Drinkable and easy. Wouldn't mind having a keg of this on tap

12 oz bottle, $10/6. Deep amber, soapy head, medium lacing. Pine, floral, citrus, caramel, pepper. Medium body. Fairly high level of sharp bitterness but the balance is really there. Well rounded. Pushing 7% but still reasonably light, and the alcohol doesnt show. Really solid late-summer/early-fall brew.

Bottle - Pours brownish-amber with a thin filmy off-white head. Nose is grassy and herbal hops with a little grapefruit. Spicy, dry bready malt. Taste is dry, bready, and spicy. Lots of herbal hops and a juicy citrus finish. Nom nom nom. Medium thin with a nice amount of carbonation.

Pours a deep amber, pretty clear, and a nice sudsy white head. Aroma of pine, floral, some sweet malts, and a bit of citrus hops. Taste follows the nose very well and is nicely balanced with the bitterness aspect. Medium bodied and the finish is pretty smooth. This is and always has been one of my favorite Southern Tier beers. I look for it each year.

Bottle on 8/13/14. Pours a medium to dark amber with a small white head. Aroma is hoppy, citrusy, sweet. Taste is pretty hoppy for the style but nicely balanced.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a deep amber into the glass with a sudsy head that light spiderweb lacing. The nose has some earthy pine and floral notes. Flavors of caramel, citrus (especially rind and peel notes), some grains and light tannins finish with a peppering spruce-pine bitter and light spices. Nicely balanced, the medium body provides a great autumn quaff, smooth yet active, complex and substantive yet not overbearing. Decent ESB.

From the 12 fl. oz. bottle. 2014 batch. Attractive light to medium amber pour with a modest off-white head. The aroma tends to emphasize the hops more than the malts. A hint of spice. It smells nice. The body is medium. The taste tends to be hop-bitter with a slight sweetness and good finish.

Transfer from BA review on 10-3-12- 
 Served on tap in a 10 oz chalice glass

 Appearance  Served an amber colored beer with a small white head. The head faded rather fast to leaves a light amount of lacing on the sides of the glass.

 Smell  The aroma was of a malty biscuit smell mixed with citrus and pine hops. While these were the dominant aromas there was a lighter caramel sweetness.

 Taste  The hops show up early in this one and create a hopped pine and citrus flavor on top of a lightly sweetened malt base. As the flavor advances more caramel sweetness comes to the tongue with some of the hop flavors growing slightly lighter in intensity. This changes however as the sweetness lessens again more toward the end due to a roasted malt flavor that comes to the tongue.

 Mouthfeel  The body of the beer is on the slightly higher than average side in terms of creaminess with the carbonation level being on the lower side. 

 Overall  Really not the best ESB out there, but not bad either. It has a decent flavor profile with some nice flavors. It is well worth a try if you have the chance.

Tap pour. Clean amber brown. Some webbing. Fruit and fresh hop on nose. Light roast malt. Taste is similar. Dry with a nice hop showing. Light bitterness. Good, round flavors. Very drinkable. A winner.
slightly cloudy amber color; slightly fruity, floral hop aroma; a nice, smooth, bitter beer; citrusy hops and bready malt withmild caramel notes; a nice,smooth, easy drinking beer

I dont know how long Southern Tier has been here in the Bucks co. Pa. area, but it is quickly becoming one of my favorite breweries.
There seasonal Harvest is another good beer.
It pours with a nice golden color with very little head production even with a vigorous pour.
Low carbos.
Very nice aroma being that of citrusy hops. Maybe even some floral in ther too. Lite malt.
To me this beer is sweet tasting, lip smacking sweet. Not soda sweet, malty sweet.
A nice balanced taste with a nice hop bite up front and sweet maltiness up bring up the rear.
A bit light in body, smooth.
You know how when youre making a brew and you pour the sweet malt into the kettle, thats the sweet lips smacking taste that Im talking about.
This is a good beer, a go to beer.
Drink well my friends.
Very good ale. Would drink a few off these. Classic yellow ale color and great taste. Refreshing!

It has a bright golden color with a slight chill haze and a small creamy white head. It fades to just a very thin covering that still makes some nice lace on the glass. The aroma has a hop filled nose with piney/citrus notes and a hint of caramel and toasted grain. Its flavor has a good malty backbone with light toasted notes as well as a mild almost fruity sweetness. This is balanced by good bitterness from the hops which add some piney/citrus notes. In the finish I picked up more of a herbal tea like hop flavor that slowly fades off the tongue. It has a solid medium body with good carbonation and a slightly slick texture.
Bottle at home. Pours orange, sweet malty nose, light fruit, taste has biscuity malt, quite sweet, fruity, dry, light spice.

Reviewed from notes.
This beer was poured into a pint glass.
The appearance was a nice hazy but almost transparent orange to brown color with a one finger white foamy head that dissipates within less than a minute leaving some decent foamy lacing.
The smell had rich English malts that seem to be slightly roasted in a sense. There is a decent nuttiness coming out as well.
The taste was roasty, malty and nutty with a delicate toasty bready note on the backend. There was no aftertaste but a quick dry finish.
On the palate, it sat about a light to medium in body with a decent sessionable quality to it. The carbonation was fairly smooth which is good for they style and for me.
Overall, good ESB that I would have again.
Bottle 355 ml, from Za Popent, Ljubljana. Pours orange with white head. Nice citrus and pine hoppy aroma. Fruity flavor with hoppy finish. Medium bodied.

Rated on 3-05-2011 (Bottle) This beer has a medium sized fizzy off-white head with a short retention, transparent gold body, fizzy, lively, slow rising carbonation, and spotty amounts of lacing. The aroma is malty, pine, citrus, and grapefruit hops. The taste is bitter, malty, pine, and citrus hops. The mouthfeel is smooth and this beer is medium bodied. This is a very quaffable beer and is not overly hoppy tasting. It is worth trying and a beer I would drink again,
bottle. amber with one finger head. sweet malt base with pleasant hoppy bite. very good.

Bottle poured a amber color with a thin coating of white head. Aroma has sweet malt, hops, and some bitterness. Mouth feel is medium and the carbonation medium low. Flavor has hops, light citrus, and caramel malted edges.
12 oz bottle pours amber with a white head. Aroma of citrus and pine. Taste is sweet malts, citrus and spices.
Delicious beer that makes a nice change from the regular IPA fare. Full bodied and well balanced, its a brew I can see myself having a few of for sure.
This is nice. Citrusy, fruity. Very nice mouthfeel, soft but slightly prickly. Fuzzy almost. Enjoyable.
Aroma is sweet and has a fair amount of citrus... mixed with some caramel in the taste... pretty good!

Tap, pours a clear amber with a thin white head, the aroma had a little more hops than I was expecting with still quite a bit of bread and caramel sweetness rounding it out, the flavor has a hop front end with some spice in the finish, nice mouthfeel, good stuff.

Creamy, sweet scotch tape aroma with faint brown sugar. Clear copper with a bubbly, white top. Mild caramel flavour with some spicy, herbal hops and faint green apple. Accents of lotus root and nuts. Almost clean finish but for some lingering nuts, medium carbonation, light body.

On Tap. Dark and inviting with a lasting head. Aroma is dominated by hops. Flavor is very hoppy but not overly bitter. Clean finish and smooth palate. Would pair well with fried foods or hot southwestern dishes.

Tämä sadonkorjuuolut on väriltään kullan keltainen, ehkä hieman kupariin vivahtava. Vaahtoa muodostuu niukasti ja se on valkoista. Tuoksu on aromaattisen humaloitu. Siinä on sitruksista hedelmäisyyttä. Maultaan olut edelleen sitruksisen hedelmäinen ja puinen. Jälkimaku on katkera ja kuiva. Ive had this a couple times now and find it quite enjoyable. Its got a slight toasted barley character to go with the more earthy english hop profile. It kind of has a tea-like flavor, but not too powerful. A nice bitterness throughout. A solid, understated kind of brew. Fresh hops are awesome.

Bottled 355ml. Nice balance between citrusy and earthy hops. Good malt profile (Crystal malt, caramel malt?). Slightly leafy. Caramel is quite present throughout. Reminiscent of Brooklyn East India Pale Ale. Nice components from the english and american take of the style.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet Vika. Pours deep golden with a small white head. The smell of hops i released from the moment I pour it in the glass. Pretty sweet and not as hoppy as expected from the nose. Very refreshing and easy drinkable beer. Citrusy aroma, nice slightly bitter finish, but a bit short.

Bottle from Vinmonopolet in Valkendorfsgate, Bergen. Pours a clear amber body with a small, bubbly white head. Aroma is pale malts and smooth, grassy noble hop tones with hints of caramel, grains and citrus. Taste is smooth caramel tones going hand in hand with pale malts and dry, grassy hops. A little alcohol stings in the finish; not surprisingly since this is fairly true to the style but with considerably more alcohol than most. Fairly high carbonation gives the beer a prickly mouthfeel without going overboard in fizzyness. Despite this, ST Harvest Ale is a smooth, well-balanced and tasty brew I wouldnt mind having access to on a regular basis in the stormy autumn months.
this beer is really nice it is not as strong as a traditional IPA but it has some great flavors.

Bottle enjoyed at home
Copper clear, white head. Smells of flowers, earthtones, hints of grass and malts. Medium malt body, nice sweetness. Pretty dry on the palate for a ESB. Finish has nice bitterness with floral notes and some grass

Bottle from Sams, Durham. Nice medium orange pour, an almost delicate carbonation and some spotty lacing. Soft fruity nose with light dry hops, certainly not the dankness one expects with the term "Harvest." But as an ESB this one rocks hard, a more subtle balance attempt than Clipper Citys sorta over the top embiggened version. Lightly fruit and dry throughout, pretty enjoyable.
Great beer for the fall. Aroma is very nice with earthy and vanilla notes. Nice feel on the palate. The hops are great and bitter in the aftertaste.

12oz bottle. Dark golden color with a rocky white head. Fresh medium hoppy aroma with some caramel, bread and nuts. The hops are floral and citrusy with some pine. Has a nice fresh feel about it, but its a little thin.

Slightly hazy orange yellow color with a large white lacing. The nose has that autumnal feel of when the weather is just getting cooler. There is some green on the nose. The palate is bright with a great clean hoppy feel. Great coolerweatherdrinking beer.

Bottle @ home during party time.Honey color, clear appearance Minimal white head but good lacing. Intense and pleasant aroma of hops, citrus, malt, biscuit, a little bit caramel. Malt, citrus taste Real bitter with a good finish. Medium Body. This beer has a lot of freshness, spectacular session beer. ESB, english hops? almost an APA. Southern tier: so far so good

On tap @ Lures, Crownsville Md-Ruby red pour w/a moderate off white head. Malt aroma. Flavors of Malt, yeast & bread dough, but also had a pretty strong hop bite on the finish. Was a little too hoppy for me, I prefer my ESBs a little more malty, this one was just too muddled for me.
(bottle)  Crystal clear amber color with tan head and some lacing.  Smooth palate.  Accelerated ABV is transparent.  Mild malty & faintly bitter flavor.  The perfect session beer.

Bottle from Shawan. Pours brown with a thin khaki head. A bit of malt on the nose. I didnt look up the beer before I drank it so I was expecting a Marzen and was surprised to get an ESB thats especially bitter on the finish. Not much malt here. Not my favorite style but decent enough.

12 oz bottle. Clear amber orange with a thick beige head that leaves some lacing. Aroma of toast, herbal hops, lemon and light caramel. Flavor is biscuit dough with light caramel sweetness and a mild hop bitterness. Medium to light body with average carbonation and a soft, smooth mouth feel. Very nice ESB, probably helps that its fresh. I like this a lot.

The aroma is full of wonderful hops.  It pours a clear golden amber with a nice tan head.  A hop heavy front is finished crisp.  It is very well balanced and doesnt leave your mouth dry.  Im very impressed.  Well done!

Halloween beer while taking care of all the trick or treaters.  Pours a tea like amber, clear, nice head.  Aroma is of biscuity malts and earthy, slightly citric hops.  Flavor is a match.  Sort of a brown ale/APA/ESB thing going on.  Good balance, not at all over the top, but certainly hoppy.  Enjoyed this quite a bit.

I poured a 12oz bottle into a tumbler.Appearance: Crystal clear, clean, copper color. Forms a good sized, eggshell colored head which retains and laces very well.Smell: Strong hop aroma as soon as the cap is popped. Light flowers, tropical fruits (sans acidity) and a hint of pine needles. Very enticing.Taste: I dont grade beer to style and Southern Tier Harvest is a perfect example of why. This is technically an ESB, yet it looks, smells and tastes much more like a traditional American IPA than an English pub-style bitter. It begins with a swift, sharp bitterness which transitions to a refreshing, tropical fruit juice-like taste and reverts back to bitterness with a strong hop bite. It has aspects of both west and east coast IPAs with the citrusy, juicy flavors (without the citric tartness), and pine needle and toffee-like sweetness. The hops linger momentarily, but otherwise the beer finishes very clean. Satisfying and tasty all around - I cant think of a single flaw with this palate.Mouthfeel: Medium-bodied, low carbonation but not tepid; slightly dry aftertaste.Drinkability: Weighing in at 6.7% ABV, Southern Tier Harvest is pretty big for an ESB, but it doesnt sacrifice palatability. The flavor is strong, but not overwhelming (perhaps for beginners, though). The body is crisp, but smooth and strong enough to stand up to food but enjoyable perfectly well on its own. One of the few hoppy beers over 5% ABV I would consider sessionable.

Aroma is grapefruit, smells hot, citrus, and pine.  Wonderful nose bouquet. Appearance is orange in color.  High hops, low malt, over powering hop.  Grapefruit taste, crisp, medium.  Too hoppy for me though..
Un po troppo alcol perfino per una ESB, manca di freschezza e non colpisce più di tanto.

12oz bottle, served in an English pint, amber pour, nice head with good lacing throughout the drink.  Good hop malt balance, can detect hop presence.  Nice fall brew, tasty, oily, medium bodied, can taste some citrus flavors, with bitter finish.  Worth trying this beer, a good Premium bitter/ESB representation.

Bottle.  Pours a clear golden orange with white head and very minimal lacing.  Smell instantly reminded me of sweet tea.  There are some citrus hops, but the sweet caramel really over powers.  The taste is the same with known hops, but a sugared candied caramel really overtakes.  This is good, but I feel like this is just s tad too sweet.  However, still a very nice brew to ring in the falling leaves down here in GA.
Golden body, white head. Aroma of wheat, cookie dough, yeast and some fruity hops. Flavour continues with same attributes. Overall this is mellow beer.

Bottle. Pours a mid-brown with virtually zero head present. Above average carbonation action in the glass.  Smells semi-hoppy and makes you think of falling leaves. Delicious flavor.. one that you can drink all day.

Bottle - wegmans sterling - pours a clear amber orange. Aroma is caramel and piney hops. Taste is a balance of bitterness and sweetness that I quite like. It is a bit thin and light, so it can easily be overpowered by stronger flavors. Overall, this seems more summer than fall, but Other than that, its OK.
Great mix of bitter and sweet.  Good caramel notes it almost seems to the nose and the palate is very smooth and warming.  Good harvest brew.
Nice light orange with small bubbles. Sweet aroma, soft hops, fruity, citrusy hops. Mostly sweet, only slightly bitter.Nice balance of flavors.

Inviting copper color with a sticky, if thin, head. Caramel and apricots in the nose. Wheat, dried apricots, caramel, and a dry finish. Some lingering banana, too. The hops provide a late, but pronounced character.

Pretty tasty

Solid if ever so slightly dissapointed, due to the high propensity of above average reviews. Full bodied, but a little charmless. Certainly not bad, but i was expecting something a bit more brash. I see its described as English in the description above, and that would fit with what I was tasting.

Pleasing hop flavor in the nose, and pronounced hop flavor on the palette.  Not typical flowery, and not an extreme overkill of hops but more than enough to make this beer get noticed as more than just an ESB.  Very pleasing and well built brew.

Draught poured in a tulip.  Large white foamy head balanced atop a beautiful golden red ale.  The body is really light with a moderate lacing.  Nose is light (which may because of the atmosphere inside).  Im getting hops, burnt sugar, and grassy notes.  Flavor is hops, grassy straw, cinnamon, with a low malt character.

UPDATED: SEP 17, 2013 Pours a clear golden-amber with a thick head.  Smells of mix of floral and grass, spruce.   Taste is mildly hoppy, with a bit of sweet malt to follow nicely - spruce, peach, grass, biscuits.

From the bottle. Nice golden color. Very refreshing beer, pumpkin smoothly blended and creamy. Caramel and nuts n spices. I cannot wait to see what Pumpking is like because for a pumpkin beer, this one alone was impressive.

Harvest Ale is an enjoyable lively hopped ESB.  Clear amber medium bodied with citrusy hop profile.  Not over the top, malts are a bit light in my opinion to be a true ESB, but worth trying nonetheless.

Bottle poured into a pint glass with a light amber color and a light tan head.  Aromas of fruit and malt are prevalent.  Taste is hoppier than expected with bitterness up front with herbal and pine notes, then malty on the back end with caramel and bread flavors as well as some earthiness.  Nice clean and relatively short finish, could be a great autumn session beer.

Bottle from Giant Eagle (Indiana).  Pours golden orange with effervescence and egg shell head.  Great lacing.  Muted citrus hops, lemon and orange peel. Citrus and grass hop flavor with watery mouth feel and slight bread, leading to moderate bitter at the end.  Meh.

Amber color with slight white head. Aroma is slight piney hops with notes of bread. Flavor is hoppy with a strong malt presence. Kind of like a light IPA with a slightly fuller body. Finish is clean, great fall session beer.

12oz bottle from Picks poured into an English Pint. Pours a clear amber with a half finger of white head. Strong aroma of pine hops with a slight toasty malt. Taste is medium bitter. Nice citrus and pine hop notes. Medium bodied with a thick yet oily texture. Lively carbonation and a long bitter finish. Overall, very good. I wish I would have bought a 6-pack instead of just a single.

Bottle.  Amber with a slight red hue.  Pours with a nice head that clings to the side of the glass.   Hoppy to the point of being close to an IPA, mellowed by the malts.  Very good all around beer.  Strong recommend.

Im not really sure what I was expecting this beer to be like when I purchased it, but it didnt turn out as I had hoped. The label is classy and elegant. I drank this beer directly out of the bottle, so I cant comment on what it looked like. Minimal aroma and medium bodied with a bitter finish that slowly tapers off. Coppery malt flavor with minimal hops, although the bottle claims it has 4 types of hops and 2 types of malts. Overall this was an enjoyable beer.
Sampled this at ABR this fall.  A very nice seasonal offering with a pleasant, yet not over whelming hop presence.
It poured a copper color with a small tan head. The aroma was of hops, pine forest and autumn leafs. The taste was of hops, light citrus, malt and some what bitter. A very decent Special Ale.

12oz bottle in a shaker.  Pours rubyish-amber with a fluffy, off-white head.  Aroma of floral and citrus hops with some caramel and cereal malts.  Flavor finishes strong with spicy hoppiness.  Average texture.  A really good beer for this style.
12oz - I expect little from the "Harvest" seasonal, but this is a noteworthy exception.  Substantial malt matching up to a well distributed hop profile.  I liked it.

pretty glorious ESB. Pours golden amber with a nice, thick off-white head. nose is heavy with lemon, lemongrass, orange, and spice. flavor is predominantly lemon and spice. nice, well-rounded with the maltiness of the barley. dry and spicy in the finish.

Thanks E.  Slightly translucent orange amber with a small white head.  Nose shows some citrus and floral notes, light malts.  Smells like an ipa.   Flavor is a little more malty, some citrus, floral, pine.  Solid beer, but nothing special as the label suggests.

Pint glass at Peel.  This pours a light brown color and has a nice spiced and malt aroma.  The flavor was much akin to an Oktoberfest and was light yet pleasant drinking.  It was understated with gentle spice, mildly fruity hops, grain, and malt.  An enjoyable beer that does nice things in a subtle way.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from Total Wine Sterling.  It pours a clear amber orange with a frothy off-white head.  The nose has a pleasantly hoppy character.  A touch of pine with notes of toast and biscuit.  The flavor has some pine resin and herbal hop notes to go with the biscuity malt.  Well balanced and a pleasure to drink.  Light to medium body with average carbonation and a relatively lengthy bitter finish.  A little strong for a session beer, but I wouldnt mind having a few of these.

On-tap at Maggies on the River in Watertown NY. Served a dark amber color with a nice head that fades to good lacing. Fresh grain aroma with citrus aroma and bit of malt sweetness. Mild flaver of malt sweetness with a bit of citrus. Fresh grain with a nice bitterness and a fairly dry finish.
 Fairly medium body, crisp, clean and refreshing. Good balance, no real hint of the 6.7% ABV. Easy drinker, tasty beer. A good seasonal beer. Another solid beer from Southern Tier.

12 oz bottle. Pours a golden honey hue. Nice slightly off white head. Aroma is floral citrus and hops. Taste is ripe citrus with possible honey? Mouthy feel with slightly hoppy finish, very good. Worth another sixer or Twelve Pack!!!

355 ml bottle. From Bodegraven, the Netherlands. 
Cloudy golden colour with small white head.
Moderate fruity floral bitter English style hops and some balancing maltiness in aroma. Tea like sweet English floral and fruity hops. Moderate bitterness. Cookies and caramel malt. Rather sweet. Soft carbonation. Would need a kick. Sweet bitterness in aftertaste.
while i tend to like british ESBs like Fullers, i found this to be more IPA than ESB. it was overtly bitter like one with many of the IPA hoplike qualities. not for me.

12oz bottle off whie head, dark amber/brown color good lacing throughout. the aroma is of a bit of spicy hop and some citrus on the front end then you end up with piney resinous flavor that just jumps out at you. very solid beer nice hop balance from front to back and the hops change flavor the warmer the beer gets.
Bottle from Kihosk. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are nice and hoppy with flowers, caramel, fruity notes and malt. Well balanced.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2012 12oz bottle. Clear orange color, thin off-white head. Good, frothy lace. Delicious, bitter hops taste. Great malt body, kinda dark bread, maybe rye. Perfect texture, crisp carbonation. Very drinkable, and refreshing, even. Really damn good. I cant imagine an ESB getting better than this. 8 / 4 / 8 / 5 / 17
Re-rate, 8/2/12: 12oz bottle, shared with abistany. Clear amber color. Good thin off-white head. Nice lighter crisp carbonation, dry texture. Lovely grainy, rye, bready aroma. Hay, very toasty malts. I love the aroma, and the awesome toasty aftertaste. Great moderate, but satisfying amount of bitterness. Lightly sweet. Nice herbal hops... abistany said basily, I thought that sounded pretty appropriate. I thought I might have given this a too-high score last fall, so I re-rated it, and Im still blown away by how good this is, super-solid seasonal. Definitely harvesty, somehow.
Bottle. Pours clear copper with off white head. Nose/taste of sweet malt, tropical fruit and light resinous hops. Finishes slightly dry and sweet. Medium body. Some mildly spicy hops. Good balance.

bottle-pours bright orange with a small white head that was gone very fast-nose is herbal, litely earthy, fruity, floral with lots of sweet lite malt notes as well.  a very balanced nose.  flavors of sweet floral hops, lite earth, sweet crystal malts, with a touch of earthy pine on the tail end.  finishes long and dry with lingering sweet malt notes mixed in.  Its a very well done esb-one of the better of this style for sure!  very tasty, balanced and well put together.  however, with that said, its notthat exciting of a beer.  hence the 3.5 rating.
Very pleasant spicy noble hop character with sweet caramel malt in near perfect balance.  Fantastic.

Pours a dark brown with a nice full head.  Smells of sweet malts, a bit touch of nuts and handfuls of hops.  Really impressed with the hop character in the nose.  On the palate, Im further impressed with the amount flavor from this ESB.  The amount of hops is profound with sweet grapefruits, toffee, caramel, nuts, and a nice cookie flavor all laying underneath the proufound hops.  Nice sessionable beer.
Bottle, pig roast.  Very sweet, bitter, a bit messy.  More of a hop bomb, with sticky sweet malt trying to balance.  Ok but didnt work for me.

Translucent copper with a thin beige head, medium body with medium-high carbonation.

Aroma: lots of sweet grapefruity hops.

Taste: caramel malt, lots of citrusy aroma hops, with a bit of piney resin..

Seems a lot like an APA or AIPA to me.

Serving glass: Poured from bottle into Nonic Imperial Pint.

Appearance: Light orange with moderate head and light lacing.

Aroma: Biscuit and tea, citrus and spicy hops.

Taste: Great balance of biscuit, toast, tea, citrus, and floral & spicy hops. Ends somewhat bitter.

Palate: Moderate carbonation, very creamy body with a nice dry finish.

Overall: A very impressive Americanized ESB overall. Definitely one of the better ones around.

Herbal notes are leafy and softly bitter, aromatic but not overly powerful. Nutty, buttery grains, and cookie malts up front. A wave of bitter follows and stays through the dry, piny herbal finish. The balance is excellent, as well as the drinkability. This is a very pleasing, and solidly built beer.
Pine and citrus in the aroma.  Flavor starts with more fruit and citrus, then finishes with a bitter punch.

From bottle. Fresh juicy hops, apricot and citrus, light resin. Orange blossom, and light sweet malt. Hazy orange amber with thin white foamy lacing head. Medium body and medium-high carbonation. Starts fairly dry, light toasted malt, bit of caramel. Carbonic acidity, huge hop flavor, fresh and floral. Citrus and pine. Apricot. Big bitter finish with light malty and bitter after.

Bottle. Poured a deep clear burnt orange. A small fizzy head did not hang around long, but good lacing on the glass. Aromas of green hops are dominating with some nice floral notes. A hint of sweet malt in the aroma as well. Taste is also hoppy but they taste more like noble hops. A grainy backbone asserts itself rapidly, battling with the hoppy bitterness. Almost no hint of the maltiness I detected on the nose. Instead a delicious spiciness adds a wonderful new element to this ESB. Texture is medium. Medium-high carbonation. Very lively on the tongue. Texture is somewhat oily. A wonderfully different beer. very tasty

Pours a light brown with yellow to orange hew. Nose is mild with bready ketones. First sip is pliant but little hop character. Too subtle for me. Finish is clean.
Bottle. Taste is slightly bitter, slightly hoppy and slightly grainy.very interesting esb. Enjoyed this

12 oz. bottle, pours a clear copper with a small white head. Aroma of buttery caramel malts, fresh English hops, and a little citrus and pine. Flavour of caramel, fresh English hops, sweet grassy malt and a slight orange zesty quality that lingers. Damn good for an ESB.

Pours a medium clear amber with white head with minimal lacing.  Aroma is caramel, tea, florals and resin.  Taste is sweet but it quickly turns nice and bitter.  It starts as a marzen and progresses into more of an IPA on the finish.  Mouthfeel is smooth.  Very interesting, easy to drink and overall solidly good.

12 oz bottle, nice deep golden color, almost no head, some lacing. Aroma is fresh and very hoppy with a clean floral scent prominent. Also noticed some mild grainy maltiness. Taste reflects the aroma with the bitterness very prominent but not too overpowering. More balanced when consumed warm as the sweetness is more pronounced. Palate is full, fairly carbonated, bitter finish.

A light copper colored brew. Nice frothy head and good carbonation. Floral-ctrus aromas. Spice and malts up front. Gets more complex with each sip. Pine and citrus. Light bitterness. Honey finish. Very good.

Bottle. Pour is a bright orange/gold with an excellent white head. Aroma is lots of citrus and floral hops, light biscuit/toast. Flavor is very nice: lots of citrus hop bitterness with a good amount of sweet malt and light toast. Palate is clean, medium-light bodied, lightly bitter finish. Very easy drinking Fall beer. Would buy again.

Tap at Gallery Bar in NYC. Rating #500 for this beer! The pour is a clear deeper amber with a fully diminishing white head. No Lace. Heavier and rich on the palate as is the norm for ST beers. Huge tannic malt earthiness in conjunction with nutty bitterness. Gets a little cheesy. Regardless, nowhere near a sessionable beer as ESB should be so it fails in that regard. More like an octoberfest that has been given an IPA hop schedule.

Aroma of resin, citrus, lemon and caramel. Appearance is copper with light tan head. Flavor matches the nose, but with a slight spice note as well; some sweet caramel in the finish. Palate is bubbly. I dont get the high rating- certainly a solid beer, but 96/100? Nothing that wowed me here.

Tap @ MacGregors Penfield: clear bronze beer with a white halo of lasted head.  Spicy hop nose but faint... chewy hop buds in the flavor though seemingly diluted by a bit...a bit minty actually...yes, minty hop flavors is pretty much what I can say here.  The body seems pretty thin though and surprisingly so for 6.4%.  Not bad though...at least it tastes fresh, diluted fresh.
Rather balanced overall, but with a distinctly hoppy finish. Very full flavor with a malty nature that is somewhat nutty, a strong finish.
Orange hue with a white head.  Citrus and flowery hop aroma.  Taste is of caramel malt.  Creamy palate with a slight bitterness, really enjoyed it.

From notes: poured clear orange-amber with a 1-finger white head.  Aroma was mildly of citrusy hops.  Medium-bodied with a slight oilyness.  Mild citrusy hops taste that gives way to a yeastiness in the finish that lingers on the tongue.  Was expecting more malt, both inthe nose and the taste.

Pours a light caramel color with a medium tan head...lively looking...good retention and lacing!  Aroma has fresh citrusy hops, lightly toasted malt, and faint caramel.  Flavor follows suit and adds some earthy notes and spicy hops.  Mouthfeel is slightly oily and the finish is lingering, earthy, and dry.  Very tasty!

Decent brew for the summer.  Pours orange-yellow with a white head, leaves some sticky lacing behind.  Aroma is citrus.  Body is kind of thin, with some malty notes before a short / dry finish.  Would drink again.
Bottled from Mitra van Bergen, Eindhoven. Clear golden colored, white head. Nose of fresh hops, some grain. Smooth bitter flavor. Excellent thirst quencher. I love this brewery.

malty aroma blended with citrus and floral hops very inviting..amber orange and red clear liquid with dissipating white head some lacing..yes its bitter but with a healthy balance of malts well blended a little citrus and peppery quality too..its not quite autumn here but going down nice on a seasonable summer night..bitterness lingersas does the dry peppery flavor light-medium bodied..overall an english bitter ale that drinks like a really good oktoberfest well done
I expected more from this beer. It was too watery! In my opinion this beer needs more body, it could have been a beer a really liked that way. Too bad.

16 ounce pint - $5.50 at Taco Mac in Canton, Georgia.

Smell: Pale malts with some soundly bready and biscuit-hinted notes to it and sweetish touch of golden syrup, maybe an infinitesimal bit of light caramel. Modestly spicy, fruity as well.

Mouthfeel: Medium-light body. Medium carbonation.

Overall: Harvest Ale is an enjoyable, quaffable brew for early Sunday morning drinking.

Bottle.
Slightly hazy dark golden with a white head leaving a lot of lacing.
Aroma: pretty hoppy, tropical, pineapple/peaches, toffee, some nuts.
Taste: pineapple, toffee and butterscotch, citrus, a hint of licorice, low bitterness.
Medium-bodied, medium carbonation.

This beer has a pretty nice colour. Looking fresh, somehow reminds me of summer. Smells pretty good with some nice hops and freshness. Doesnt come trough in the taste very much. Its okay, but ive had better beers from them.
Pours a copper color.  Decent head to start but quickly went away.  Nice hop aroma.  Hops in the taste but not over powering.  Bitterness balances out the sweetness well.
Catching up on some old ratings. I would like to rate again, but I remember liking the aroma more than the taste.

Reviewed from notes.

Pours a nice golden copper color with a white head and some good ringy lacing on the way down. The nose brings a good amount of hops forward with some earth, pine, and herbal notes coming through. Slight caramel and toffee in there as well. Hops take center stage in the flavor as well, though not to the extent that they had in the nose. Really nice body and carbonation well nice bitterness. Really smooth and a great fall beer.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 10-26-2010
Hazy golden color with a small beige head. Aroma of citrus hops. Taste is lightly bitter, and citrusy, medium body, slick feel, pretty good.

Bottle (35 cl) from the Cracked Kettle. Shady golden, medium biref white head. Bready and bisquity malt aroma with lots of floral and herbal british hops. Medium bodied and smooth. Well balanced with a nice lingering bitterness.

At a tasting, thanks Eyal, pours orange to yellow with a medium head, aroma of grapefruit, pineapple, malt and lemon, dry with flavor of grapefruit, orange, malt, nice bitterness balanced with a pleasant acidity, medium bodied, easy to drink.

Bottle sampled at Akkurat, Stockholm. Pours out in a clear pale amber colour with a rich white head. Rather clean and soapy aroma with hints of caramel and leafy and orangey hops. Medium-bodied with notes of caramel, strawberries,  grass, yellow plums and mild grapefruit. Clean, almost streamlined mouthfeel. Medium-bitter finish of grass, lemon and leaves. Good intentions but lacking soul.

At a tasting, thanks zvikar, light orange colour and a litle hazy, aroma of peach and mandarine with a light malty backbone,  flavoue of bread with touches of nuts and herbs, easy to drink, quite nice.
Bottle at a tasting, thanks zvikar: caramel malt, orange and mandarin hop flavor but not dominant, the flavor is the same but even more subdued, more bready, some cardboard, a dissapointment.

Bottle at a tasting. Thanks zvikar. Slightly hazy golden. Aroma of hops, pine needles, flowers, slightly biscuity malt and some fruits. Sweetish flavor with malt, a grainy touch and bitter fruity hops. Medium-bodied.
Bottle from Cracked Kettle. Golden body, with medium head. Nose of fruits, sweet malts. Taste is also fruity, malty and sweet. But probably too sweet.

(Sample Date: 10/22/2010   Source:Other)   On tap TJs at Jefferson Hotel Richmond. Resiny floral hop nose with some background caramel. Clear golden with small white head. Clean with crisp hop flavor. Some grape like flavors especially in the finish. Finish is clean and lightly bitter.

Poured into a pint glass.

4.5 A: Clear golden yellow color. Two inches of half frothy, half creamy head. Good retention and lots of lacing.

4.0 S: Fresh and clean smelling. Pine and lemon hops in the nose, very nice. Pretty much neutral malt character.

4.0 T: Floral and herbal hops are the biggest flavor. Malts are mainly neutral with a bit of biscuity character.

3.0 M: Light body, too light for my liking. If it were heavier, it would be a damn good brew. Good carbonation, good otherwise.

4.5 D: Very drinkable. Easy to put down. I probably should have given a bigger penalty for the lack of body, but this is so damn drinkable.

Serving type: bottle
